newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy budget goes to parlt commission on April 8.
newsitem.headline: Italy budget goes to parlt commission on April 8.

text.p: The Italian government's proposed mini-budget will go before the budget commission of the Chamber of Deputies (lower house) on April 8, its chairman said on Thursday.
Bruno Solaroli told reporters that the first session would be a hearing from Treasury undersecretary Piero Giarda on the state accounts.
Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi was due to speak at the end of the general discussion of the package on Thursday.

Prime Minister Romano Prodi's centre-left government last week unveiled a controversial mini-budget designed to plug a hole in state accounts and ensure that Italy is a founder member of the European single currency at its 1999 launch.
The package, designed to raise 15.5 trillion lire in 1997, has been slammed by opposition parties and business leaders for not addressing structural issues.
A requirement for firms to pay taxes on huge severance payment funds two years early has also been criticised.
